column1: 4.  The  Appellant  belatedly  claimed  that  he  was  involved  in  a  different
business  and  a  different  source  of

column2: services  for  the  first  time  before  the  TAC  but,  the  Appellant  failed  to
maintain and prepare a statement of accounts in a manner that the profits
and income from each such activity may be separately identified (ICICI
Bank Limited v. CGIR CA/Tac/28/2013 decided on 16.07.2015);

column1: 5.  The  Appellant  failed  to  demonstrate  that  he  provided  transportation  to

column2: tourists and passengers and therefore, the Appellant does not fall within
the meaning of section 45 (2)(d)(iv) of the IRA, 2006.
